creator: david.m.ishee@lmco.com
text:
I am using an FTP task to send files in a single directory to a remote machine. 
I get this error:

could not create directory: 550 server: File exists.

I have set depends="no". The directory structure already exists and doesn't 
need to be created again. This worked fine in 1.4.1. Let me know if you need 
more information.

creator: stevel@apache.org
text:
you are talking to a wu-ftp FTP server on linux, arent you.

set ignorenoncriticalerrors=true and it will ignore the error, which the server
is erroneously sending back.
I'm talking to an SGI running IRIX 6.5. I'll try the suggestion you made.
creator: david.m.ishee@lmco.com

text: The suggestion to use ignoreNoncriticalErrors="true" works. Thanks.
creator: david.m.ishee@lmco.com
stevel@apache.org
text:
closing the report. you should know there is some work on to change behaviour
(CD to a dir before trying to create it), but this turned out to be a bit
unreliable in ant 1.5.2.
